meanings.definition: The property of materials that exhibit both viscous and elastic characteristics when undergoing deformation.
meanings.sent1: The viscoelasticity of the rubber band allowed it to stretch and then return to its original shape.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the viscoelasticity of different substances to understand their behavior under pressure.
meanings.sent3: The silly putty showed its viscoelasticity by bouncing off the wall and then slowly oozing down.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like the viscoelasticity of a spring, always bouncing back after being stretched thin.
meanings.sent5: The viscoelasticity of the dough made it perfect for shaping into intricate designs.

meanings.definition: The ability of a material to deform under stress and return to its original shape when the stress is removed.
meanings.sent1: The viscoelasticity of the memory foam mattress allowed it to contour to the body's shape.
meanings.sent2: Athletes appreciate the viscoelasticity of sports equipment that absorbs impact without permanent deformation.
meanings.sent3: The balloon's viscoelasticity made it a fun toy as it could be squeezed and then bounce back.
meanings.sent4: His resilience was like the viscoelasticity of a rubber band, always bouncing back from setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The viscoelasticity of the gelatin dessert made it wobble and jiggle on the plate.
